answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Blurred vision can be due to glaucoma, refractive errors (near or far sightedness), diabetes, retinal detachment, optic stroke, infection or injury to eye, migraines, floaters, brain tumors, temporal arteritis or due to bleeding into the eye.It is best not to ignore this as this was sudden onset. Consult an eye specialist immediately. Take care!
It could be a retinal detachment you should go to your local doctor, because it could be serious.
signs of optic nerve or retinal illness, needs opthalmologist to sort outby take care

question: over night my vision became very blurred and i also had white spots as if i'd looked at a bright light this has not improved after 3 day
title: blurred vision and white spots
